api_url.description: URL to the RHOAS services API. By default using production API (https://api.openshift.com).

auth_url.description: The auth url is used to get an access token for the service by passing the offline token. By default production is used (https://sso.redhat.com/auth/realms/redhat-external).

client_id.description: The client id is used to when getting the access token using the offline token. By default cloud-services is used.

offline_token.description: The offline token is a refresh token with no expiry and can be used by non-interactive processes to provide an access token for Red Hat OpenShift Application Services. The offline token can be obtained from [https://cloud.redhat.com/openshift/token](https://cloud.redhat.com/openshift/token). As the offline token is a sensitive value that varies between environments it is best specified using the `OFFLINE_TOKEN` environment variable.

cloud_provider.description: The cloud provider to use. A list of available cloud providers can be obtained using `data.rhoas_cloud_providers`.

created_at.description: The RFC3339 date and time at which the Kafka instance was created

href.description: The path to the Kafka instance in the REST API

id.description: The unique identifier for the Kafka instance

kind.description: The kind of resource in the API

multi_az.description: Whether the Kafka instance should be highly available by supporting multi-az

name.description: The name of the Kafka instance

owner.description: The username of the Red Hat account that owns the Kafka instance

region.description: The region to use. A list of available regions can be obtained using `data.rhoas_cloud_providers_regions`.

status.description: The status of the Kafka instance

updated_at.description: The RFC3339 date and time at which the Kafka instance was last updated

version.description: The version of Kafka the instance is using

block.description: `rhoas_kafka` manages a Kafka instance in Red Hat OpenShift Streams for Apache Kafka.

client_id.description: The client id associated with the service account

client_secret.description: The client secret associated with the service account. It must be stored by the client as the server will not return it after creation

description.description: A description of the service account

name.description: The name of the service account

owner.description: The username of the Red Hat account that owns the service account

block.description: `rhoas_service_account` manages a service account in Red Hat OpenShift Streams for Apache Kafka.
`rhoas_cloud_providers_regions` provides a list of the regions available for Red Hat OpenShift Streams for Apache Kafka.
`rhoas_cloud_providers` provides a list of the cloud providers available for Red Hat OpenShift Streams for Apache Kafka.
`rhoas_kafkas` provides a list of the Kafkas accessible to your organization in Red Hat OpenShift Streams for Apache Kafka.
`rhoas_service_accounts` provides a list of the service accounts accessible to your organization in Red Hat OpenShift Streams for Apache Kafka.
